column5: Haven't been here in a while and thought this was note worthy to get back in action on the WC site...Landed on 5/30/11 in 10FOW using a 3/4oz Johnson Silver Minnow tipped with a ring worm.Final Stats -Just over 44"Just under 22lbsCurrent Northwesthern Ontario Conditions:Water Temps in low to mid 50'sWalleyes - 5 to 17fow related to flowing water and weedsIce Out - 05/08/11
GREAT catch! Interested in knowing more about your lure having the ring worm attached? Do you always use something on your silver minnows? Color?
I always tip my Silver Spoons with a 4 inch grub. White or Chart.

The presentation seems to work better on slower days when the big ones are hesitating. That's exactly what was happen on this day. Also regarding color, I think it is more of an action thing than a color thing. My hope is the slower action will trigger them to strike when they might otherwise sit there.

Walleye Guru, you might want to look at your signature on the bottom of your posts. I believe you have a typo, and I doubt you wnat to have that wrong especially as it represents your company and is a quote from someone else. Nice fish.
Congrats on the nice pike and good job on the CPR!
